data.question: What is the publication year of the article discussing Lanthanum Coordination Networks?
Who are the corresponding authors for the article on Lanthanum Coordination Networks?
data.answer: Neil R. Champness and Martin Schröder

data.question: What is the topology of the lanthanide coordination polymer labeled as 1?
What ligand is used as a bridging ligand in the construction of the lanthanide coordination networks mentioned?
What is the coordination number of the La(III) center in compound 2?
What unusual anion is found to chelate the La(III) center in compound 2?
What is the role of the BPh4- anion in the synthesis of the lanthanide coordination polymers?
data.answer: To generate noninterpenetrating frameworks with large internal cavities

data.question: Why are lanthanide ions considered attractive for discovering new network topologies?
data.answer: Due to their high coordination numbers and flexible coordination sphere

data.question: How does the presence of coordinating nitrate anions affect the connectivity of the structures?
data.answer: It results in low connectivity, four-fold and three-fold respectively

data.question: What is the effect of air exposure on crystals of compounds 1 and 2?
data.answer: They decay quickly via solvent loss

data.question: What is the origin of the [Ph2B(OMe)2]- anion in the synthesis?
Are the coordination numbers of lanthanide ions typically high or low?
Is the 4^4.6^6 topology found in compound 1 considered common for lanthanide-based frameworks?
Does compound 2 exhibit a higher coordination number for La(III) centers compared to compound 1?
Is the [Ph2B(OMe)2]- anion a product of a high-temperature reaction?
Are compounds 1 and 2 stable in air?
Is the 4^6.6^2.8^2 topology of compound 2 indicative of a simple cubic structure?
Does the presence of BPh4- anions in the structure lead to interpenetrating frameworks?
Are the five-connected nodes in compounds 1 and 2 described by a simple polyhedron geometry?
Is the methanolysis of BPh4- under mild conditions a common method for generating [Ph2B(OMe)2]- anions?
